Violation_Type: Procedural violation in refugee status determination
Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment and state protection analysis
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed forced recruitment by FARC in Colombia
Decision_Outcome: Negative determination by Refugee Protection Division
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; decision set aside and remanded for re-determination
Claimant_Status: Asylum seeker claiming persecution by FARC
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to provide clear credibility finding and inadequate state protection analysis
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to forced recruitment by FARC
Legal_Standard: Negative determination must treat allegations as true if no explicit credibility rejection
Assessment_Factor: Personal circumstances in state protection analysis
Procedural_Issue: Lack of clarity in decision reasoning
Credibility_Assessment: Veiled credibility finding without proper justification
Evidence_Assessed: Narrative of forced recruitment by FARC
Governing_Rule: A negative decision requires either a clear adverse credibility finding or acceptance of the claim for purposes of analysis
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced military service by non-state actor (FARC)
Cause_Description: Applicant alleged persecution by FARC and sought refugee status; claim denied due to flawed assessment
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 96(1) of IRPA – failure in procedural fairness and analysis
Evidence_Issues: Lack of detailed scrutiny of applicant's evidence
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Sections 96, 97
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient individualized assessment of state protection availability
Decision_Rationale: Failure to conduct proper credibility and state protection analysis constitutes reviewable error
Evidentiary_Issues: Ambiguous credibility findings and lack of personalization in state protection analysis
